alert.note: Alert for Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 5:14AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Travis. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Torrential rainfall could at times reduce visibility to less than 1/4 mile and make it hard to see the areas of flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Austin, Pflugerville, Austin Bergstrom Int Airport, Manor, Bee Cave, West Lake Hills, Rollingwood, Barton Creek, Hornsby Bend, Sunset Valley, Camp Mabry, Del Valle, McKinney Falls State Park and Lost Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night and in low visibility situations when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
